welcomeConfig.title: Sitecore XM Cloud Certification Prep
welcomeConfig.description:
This application is designed to simulate multiple-choice questions, helping you prepare for the [Sitecore XM Cloud Developer Certification Exam](https://learning.sitecore.com/learn/course/external/view/elearning/1253/study-guide-sitecore-xm-cloud-developer-certification-exam).

**Questions cover the following competencies:**

- XM Cloud Architecture and Developer Workflow
- Deployment of XM Cloud Projects
- Renderings and Layouts
- Sitecore Content Serialization
- Sitecore APIs & Webhooks
- XM Cloud Pages
- Security for Developers
- Data Modeling

Each practice exam you start contains **randomly selected multiple-choice questions** (out of a pool of several hundered curated questions) and requires a score of **80% or above** to pass. You have a **limitited time** to complete the exam.

**DISCLAIMER:** This free study aid is not affiliated with Sitecore or any other organization. Practice exam questions asked here are not guaranteed to be asked on the official exam.  
All information is sourced from Sitecore's official documentation.

questions.question: If a developer wants to limit the serialization of items under a Navigation item to just the item itself and then one step below, what property should the developer add to the includes to indicate this limitation?

According to the Sitecore XM Cloud Documentation for Developers, the scope property is used to control the depth of the serialization tree. The scope property can have one of the following values:

- **Self** — only the item itself is serialized, not its descendants.
- **Children** — the item and its immediate children are serialized, not the grandchildren or further descendants.
- **Subtree** — the item and all its descendants are serialized, regardless of the depth.

To limit the serialization of items under a Navigation item to just the item itself and then one step below, the developer should add the scope property with the value Children to the includes section of the serialization configuration file. For example:

```yaml
includes:
- name: Navigation
  path: /sitecore/content/MySite/Navigation
  scope: Children
```

questions.question: A developer needs to create a site for a company and must define the data structures in Sitecore to create items and content. What should the developer use to define the data structures?
questions.explanation:
According to the Sitecore XM Cloud Documentation for Developers, templates are the fundamental concept in Sitecore that determine the structure and behavior of content items. Templates define the fields, sections, and parameters that make up each item. Templates also enable inheritance, which allows items to share common fields and properties from their base templates. There are different types of templates in Sitecore, such as data templates, branch templates, and command templates.

To create the data structures for a site, the developer should use data templates, which define the fields used to control how data is entered. Data templates form the framework around which items are built. Sitecore associates a data template with every item in the content tree. The field types determine the editing controls shown to the user and they contain the raw values that are stored in the database.

The other options are not correct:

- **Rendering parameters** are custom properties for a component that can be changed by the content author in the XM Cloud Pages editor. Rendering parameters allow the content author to customize the appearance and behavior of the component, but they do not define the data structure of the content item.
- **Renderings** are items that define the metadata and parameters for a component. Renderings link a component to a data template, a headless variant, and a rendering parameter template. Renderings are used to create and manage components in the Components builder, but they do not define the data structure of the content item.
- **Component data sources** are content items that provide the content for a component. Component data sources can have fields, such as text, image, or link, that can be edited by the content author in the XM Cloud Pages editor. Component data sources are based on data templates, but they are not templates themselves.

questions.question: A developer wants to invite a team member to their organization in the Sitecore Cloud Portal and give them access to only three specific apps. What role should they assign to this new team member?

To give the team member access to an app, click Add app and select the app and the access level you want them to have in that app. You can repeat this step for up to 25 apps. questions.question: Which of the following must be done to delete or remove a user from an administrator role?

questions.question: Why should a developer assign security to roles instead of users when setting up security on a site?

options.A: Security roles can assign individual rights and permissions to be configured by users.
options.B: Role-based security allows multiple users to have the same username.
options.C: Security can be managed more efficiently as the rights and permissions apply to a group of users.
options.D: Individual users with a role can set and configure their own item security permissions.

questions.explanation: According to the Sitecore XM Cloud Documentation for Developers, security roles define how different users access different types of records in Sitecore. To control access to data and resources, you can create or modify security roles and change the security roles that are assigned to your users. A user can have multiple security roles. Security role privileges are cumulative. Users are granted the privileges that are available in each role that's assigned to them2. Instead, you only need to assign and manage the access rights on the parent items and then specify whether their descendants can inherit these access rights3.

questions.question: A content author is unable to edit a company webpage in Sitecore. Where is the best place to check if the user has Write access to this content item?

questions.question: When a developer selects the base templates for a new data template, what happens if those base templates contain a field with the same name?

questions.question: A developer needs to clear the Experience Edge cache to resolve a publishing issue. How can that be done?

questions.question: How can a developer differentiate between XM Cloud Components and Headless SXA Components?

questions.question: Which of the following needs to happen for a developer to log in into the XM Cloud Deploy app?

options.A: An Organization Admin or Organization Owner must update their role in the Sitecore Cloud Portal.
options.B: Only the Organization Owner can update their role in the Sitecore Cloud Portal.
options.C: Only the Organization Owner can update their role using the XM Cloud Deploy app.
options.D: An Organization Admin or Organization Owner must update their role using the XM Cloud Deploy app.

questions.explanation: To access the Deploy app, the user must be granted the Admin role in the Sitecore Cloud Portal by an Org Admin or Org Owner. It cannot be done from the Deploy app itself.

questions.question: A developer wants to deploy to XM Cloud, but the project is not using a source code provider that has an out-of-the-box connector. How can they deploy?

options.A: Use the Sitecore Cloud CLI to create a project and deployment.
options.B: Create a Sitecore Update Package using SCS.
options.C: Use Vercel to connect to their source code provider.
options.D: Create a custom connector for the Deploy app.

questions.explanation: The **Sitecore Cloud CLI** allows deployment to XM Cloud regardless of source code provider. It can authenticate, create projects, push items, and trigger deployments.

questions.question: Which of the following tasks are performed by the publishing pipeline to create an accurate snapshot of the content? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: The publishing pipeline recalls additional entities, calculates dependencies, and resolves dependencies. Archiving expired content is not part of publishing.

questions.question: The XM Cloud Pages editor comes with a set of devices (Desktop, Mobile). Which fields must a developer specify to add a new device?
questions.explanation: New devices require **width (px)**, **visibility options** (Disabled, Fixed, Optional), and **an icon**.

questions.question: A multinational clothing company wants regional sites per country with same branding but unique content. What’s the most efficient rendering host deployment?

options.A: Separate XM Cloud instances per region
options.C: A single rendering host with JSS multisite
options.D: One site collection/site for all regions

questions.explanation: Using JSS multisite, a single rendering host supports multiple sites, centralizing updates while allowing regional content.

questions.question: When deploying to XM Cloud, which resources are provisioned?

options.A: CM instance, Editing Host, and Experience Edge

questions.explanation:
Provisioning includes:

- **Content Management instance**
    
- **Editing Host**
    
- **Experience Edge**

questions.question: A developer needs to remove a site collection folder. Which script should they run from the Content Editor?
questions.explanation: The “Remove Site Collection Folder” script cleanly removes a site collection and its associated items.

questions.question: A multinational company wants dedicated content per brand and country, within one Sitecore instance. Which approach?

options.B: One site collection and site for all
options.C: Individual site collections per brand + site per country
options.D: One site per brand, language per country

questions.explanation: Best practice: **site collection per brand, site per country**. This provides structure and separation while using one XM Cloud instance.

questions.question: Which of the following is part of the out-of-the-box technology stack for XM Cloud?
questions.explanation: XM Cloud includes **React** in its technology stack, typically used with JSS for headless front-end development.
